This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=GEO-HYDRO.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-10T09:09:18Z Victor Bense (ENV) 2015-03-10T09:09:11+00:00 2015-03-10T09:09:11+00:00 Fault zone hydrogeology - Geofluids Thematic Issue https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;1766aacd.1503 Dear All,<br>We are writing to invite you to submit a manuscript to an upcoming Geofluids Special Issue on \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdFault Zone Hydrogeology\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.<br>The topic of fault zone hydrogeology is of broad interest to the geofluids community in light of the importance of fault zone-controlled fluid flow in a suite of geological processes such as seismicity, hydrocarbon migration, and the genesis of ore deposits. Moreover, the study of fluid flow along faults plays a central role in the sustainable development of geothermal systems, and the evaluation of the safety of CCS and unconventional gas extraction.<br>Fault zone hydrogeology is a highly [...] Michael Rivett 2015-03-09T18:16:26+00:00 2015-03-09T18:16:26+00:00 FW: IAH Rome Congress 2015, abstract deadline is approaching! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;ea696fc3.1503 Dear listing,<br><br>Please see the email below from IAH \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Italy.<br><br>Dr Michael Rivett<br>Senior Lecturer - Earth Sciences (Contaminant Hydrogeology)<br><br>School of Geography, Earth & Environmental Sciences<br>University of Birmingham, Birmingham, B15 2TT, UK<br>Tel. +44 (0)121 414 3957<br>Fax. +44 (0)121 414 4942<br>email: M.O.Rivett@bham.ac.uk<mailto:M.O.Rivett@bham.ac.uk><br>website: http://www.gees.bham.ac.uk/<br><br>The contents of this e-mail may be privileged and are confidential. It may not be disclosed, used, or copied in any way by anyone other than the addressee. If received in error please notify the sender then delete it from your system. Should you communicate with the sender by e-mail, you [...] Jones, Dave 2015-03-09T16:11:58+00:00 2015-03-09T16:11:58+00:00 Vote in the Geological Society Council elections https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;a067d4b6.1503 Voting is open in the Geological Society's Council Elections. The Council elections are your opportunity to choose who should serve on Council to best represent the interests of Fellows and to shape the future of the Society.<br><br>Full details on all the candidates is available on the Society's website - http://www.geolsoc.org.uk/vote15 [...] Bruce Misstear 2015-03-09T08:31:40+00:00 2015-03-09T08:31:40+00:00 PhD in groundwater recharge assessment, Trinity College Dublin https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;7c3a61ae.1503 We are seeking an outstanding candidate for a 4-year PhD study into the impacts of changing climate on groundwater recharge, focusing on fractured-rock aquifers. The student will be based at Trinity College Dublin. The research project is part of the Irish Centre for Research in Applied Geosciences (iCRAG), which is funded under the Science Foundation Ireland Research Centres Programme and is co-funded under the European Regional Development Fund. BS 8485:2015 will replace BS 8485:2007.<br><br>The closing date for comment is 30 April 2015<br><br>The Code of Practice has been thoroughly revised and greatly improved<br>compared to the present version. The guidance is much better founded and<br>more rigorous. Please ignore flyer send earlier today. Corinna Abesser 2015-02-24T13:14:32+00:00 2015-02-24T13:14:32+00:00 Registration details available for Instrumenting groundwater meeting on 21st April https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;59d8b784.1502 Dear Colleagues,<br><br>the registration details for the meeting<br><br>Instrumenting groundwater - Novel technologies for groundwater research<br><br>on 21st April 2015, at the Priory Rooms, Birmingham, B4 6AF<br><br>are now available.<br><br>Please see the attached flyer for further details.<br><br>Regards,<br><br>Corinna Abesser Paul Howlett 2015-02-23T16:13:55+00:00 2015-02-23T16:13:55+00:00 Groundwater: Our Hidden Asset \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Call for Posters, and Early Career Hydrogeologists\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Conference 2015 - challenges for new hydrogeologists https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;944db735.1502 Groundwater: Our Hidden Asset<br>Recent developments in hydrogeology, built upon the legacy of Dick Downing<br>8th July 2015, Burlington House, London<br>Richard Allen (‘Dick’) Downing, who died in 2013, was a geological polymath who worked for most of career as a hydrogeologist, making contributions on almost every aspect of the science. In this meeting five eminent hydrogeologists will briefly assess Dick’s contribution to a major hydrogeological topic and describe the recent progress that has been made in the field. Keele<br>University, UK.<br><br>Dear Colleagues,<br><br>We have a couple of places that have just become available on the<br>fully-funded, 7-day, residential "Geophysical Skills Development for<br>Environmental Scientists" course running 28th February - 6th march 2015<br>at Keele University, Staffordshire and Grange-over-sands, Cumbria, UK. [...] Sally Little 2015-02-20T11:47:57+00:00 2015-02-20T11:47:57+00:00 ECSA 55 Unbounded boundaries and shifting baselines: Estuaries and coastal seas in a rapidly changing world https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;e0b33cd.1502 *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Dear colleagues,<br><br>Join us at ECSA\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds next major Symposium, ECSA 55 - Unbounded boundaries and shifting baselines: Estuaries and coastal seas in a rapidly changing world, from the 6-9 September 2015 in London, UK.<br><br>ECSA 55 will bring together a global multi-disciplinary community of researchers and professionals to discuss and address issues of outstanding scientific importance in the science and management of estuaries and coastal seas. The symposium will focus on learning lessons from the past, discussing the current and forecasting for the future, spanning environmental, anthropogenic and climatic impacts on estuaries and coastal seas across the [...] Besien, Tim 2015-02-13T16:06:55+00:00 2015-02-13T16:06:55+00:00 Environment Agency makes live groundwater level data available https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;c862380e.1502 Dear all<br><br>In the last month live groundwater level information for England has been made available via the following website:<br><br>http://www.gaugemap.co.uk/<br><br>This groundwater level information is particularly relevant for people living in areas prone to groundwater flooding.<br><br>Best wishes, Tim<br><br>Tim Besien<br>E&B Senior Advisor (Groundwater Technical Specialist)<br>Environment Agency, England and Wales<br>* Internal: 7 12 4554<br>* External: +44 (0)117 934 4554<br>* Mobile: 07768 006203<br>* e mail: tim.besien@environment-agency.gov.uk<mailto:tim.besien@environment-agency.gov.uk> [...] Lymer, James 2015-02-05T13:55:08+00:00 2015-02-05T13:55:08+00:00 Re: Abstracts - Emerging contaminants in waters and soils event, Sheffield on Wednesday 4 March 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;4b3e13c6.1502 Dear all,<br><br>A reminder for the 1 day symposium focussed on Emerging contaminants in waters and soils held on Wednesday, 4th March 2015 in Sheffield, South Yorkshire and presentation abstracts are now available.<br><br>An early bird discount is available and registration is online<http://mxm.mxmfb.com/rsps/ct/c/1127/r/106687/l/2357409>.<br><br>Posters will be on display during the breaks for this meeting. If you wish to present a poster please contact Kevin Prior<mailto:kevin@thackie.co.uk> via e-mail. It may not be disclosed, used, or copied in any way by anyone other than the addressee. If received in error please notify the sender then delete it from your system. Should you communicate with the sender by e-mail, you consent to The University of [...] Michael Rivett 2015-01-27T23:37:54+00:00 2015-01-27T23:37:54+00:00 Karst Groundwater at Birmingham 2015 (KG@B2015) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;aae524f2.1501 Karst Groundwater at Birmingham 2015 (KG@B2015)<br><br>As most hydrogeologists will be aware substantial areas of England and Wales are underlain by carbonate rocks \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and carbonate groundwater systems are commonly karst groundwater systems! Globally the importance of karst groundwater is widely recognized with many international conferences but it is 20 years since the last such conference in Britain. Now the International Association of Hydrogeologists through its Karst Commission, the International Speleological Union through its Commission of Karst Hydrogeology and Speleogenesis and the International Geographical Union through its Karst Commission are jointly sponsoring a major international meeting at Birmingham University in [...] Carlo Bianco 2015-01-26T09:57:51+00:00 2015-01-26T09:57:51+00:00 Short course announcement @ INTERPORE 2015: Nanoparticles transport in porous media https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;1031f7ec.1501 In the framework of the 7th International Conference on Porous Media & Annual Meeting organized by INTERPORE, the Groundwater Engineering Group of Politecnico di Torino is pleased to announce the short course:<br><br>MNMs: A MODELLING TOOL FOR NANOPARTICLE TRANSPORT IN POROUS MEDIA<br>May 21-22, 2015, Padova (Italy)<br><br>The course provides an insight into the mechanisms governing colloidal transport in saturated porous media under both constant and transient hydro-chemical conditions, with eventual clogging of the porous medium.<br>Part of the course will be devoted to the practical use of MNMs 2014 (Micro- and Nanoparticle transport, filtration and clogging Model - Suite), [...] Corinna Abesser 2015-01-23T00:59:28+00:00 2015-01-23T00:59:28+00:00 CALL FOR ABSTRACTS: HW5- Societal relevance of Groundwater: Ever Increasing Demands on a Limited Resource https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;1a754d6.1501 Dear colleagues,<br><br>please consider contributing to the upcoming workshop on<br><br>SOCIETAL RELEVANCE OF GROUNDWATER: EVER INCREASING DEMANDS ON A LIMITED RESOURCE<br><br>which will be held at the XXVI General Assembly of the IUGG , in Prague, in June 22 - July 2, 2015.<br><br>The workshop description is given below. To submit your abstract, please visit [...] Corinna Abesser 2015-01-23T00:35:52+00:00 2015-01-23T00:35:52+00:00 CALL FOR ABSTRACTS: Instrumenting groundwater - Novel technologies for groundwater research https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;37e96ae7.1501 Dear colleagues,<br><br>We are seeking presentations (both oral and posters) for the upcoming meeting on<br><br>Instrumenting groundwater - Novel technologies for groundwater research<br><br>which will be held on 21st April 2015 at the Priory Rooms, Birmingham.<br><br>This meeting offers an opportunity to learn about new technologies in groundwater instrumentation and to exchange experiences with experts from different fields of the hydrogeological research community in academia, industries and government agencies. It will bring together scientists, engineers, water managers, regulators, consultants and policy-makers from universities, research institutes, the water industry, the Environment Agency and DEFRA. The meeting will also contribute towards Continuing [...] Corinna Abesser 2015-01-20T11:53:28+00:00 2015-01-20T11:53:28+00:00 CALL FOR ABSTRACTS: 17th IWA International Conference on Diffuse Pollution and Eutrophication https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;c0ec7772.1501 Dear colleagues,<br><br>You may be interested in submitting an abstract to<br><br>17th IWA International Conference on Diffuse Pollution and Eutrophication<br>13 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 18 September, 2015<br>Berlin, Germany<br><br>Conference Themes<br>1. Pollutants and sources of diffuse pollution in surface and ground waters<br>2. Diffuse pollution (nutrients, carbon, heavy metals,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd) from agriculture and forestry<br>3. Diffuse pollution (nutrients, carbon, heavy metals,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd) from urban areas and mining<br>4. Diffuse pollution under global changes<br>5. Nutrients and eutrophication issues<br>6. Surface waters under multiple stress<br>7. Modelling and monitoring<br>8. Policies, regulations and education to control diffuse pollution<br>9. Integrated watershed management towards controlling [...] Jackson, Christopher R. 2015-01-16T10:46:28+00:00 2015-01-16T10:46:28+00:00 Current PhD opportunities in hydrogeology https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;425ef59b.1501 Please find below a list of some current groundwater related PhD opportunities involving BGS and a number of universities through associated Doctoral Training Partnerships, which may be of interest, or which you may wish to circulate.<br><br>Regards,<br>Chris<br><br>Chris Jackson<br>British Geological Survey, Keyworth<br><br>Imperial College<br>Scale dependent recharge and storage in the Chalk aquifer and their impact on sustainable yield from adits during drought, using the example of the River Colne catchment<br>https://workspace.imperial.ac.uk/grantham/Public/SSCP%20DTP/DTP%20projects%202015/CEE_Butler_2015.pdf [...] Binley, Andrew 2015-01-15T10:45:16+00:00 2015-01-15T10:45:16+00:00 Two Temporary Graduate Research Assistants (Macronutrient Hydrology) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;d1ce67ea.1501 Please pass on to potential applicants. Thanks.<br><br>Two Temporary Graduate Research Assistants (Macronutrient Hydrology) on a joint Queen Mary University of London - Lancaster University project.<br>Post holder will be based on Dorset, with access to field sites in Wiltshire.<br><br>6 month position April - September 2015.<br>Closing date for applications: 9 February 2015 [...] Parker, Alison 2015-01-13T12:46:36+00:00 2015-01-13T12:46:36+00:00 Challenges of groundwater monitoring in a capacity poor setting https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;74c89f2c.1501 Dear all,<br><br>Please find below and attached details of a meeting organised by the British Hydrological Society which might be of interest to you.<br><br>Alison<br><br>Challenges of groundwater monitoring in a capacity poor setting<br>Thursday 5th February 2015<br>6.30pm to 8.00pm<br>The Institution of Civil Engineers<br>One Great George Street, London<br>(Nearest tube: Westminster)<br>This evening meeting will investigate some of the issues associated with water management in a humanitarian context and explore to see if technology can offer any potential solutions. In a world where groundwater studies are carried out by foreign experts, why should local water supply engineers [...] Lymer, James 2015-01-12T08:38:13+00:00 2015-01-12T08:38:13+00:00 Re: Royal Society of Chemistry event - Emerging Contaminants in Waters and Soils Symposium, 4 March 2015, Sheffield https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GEO-HYDRO;d11ce472.1501 Dear all,<br><br>The RSC Environmental Chemistry Group (ECG) in collaboration with the Water Science Forum (WSF) and International Network of Environmental Forensics (INEF) are pleased to notify you of a 1 day symposium focussed on Emerging contaminants in waters and soils. The meeting is to be held on Wednesday, 4th March 2015 in Sheffield, South Yorkshire. [...]
